Question: What specific amendments are made to the Sea Area entries for the South Coast of Ireland under these Rules?

Passages.Passage: 2. Schedule 1 to the Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ships) Rules 2020 (S.I. No. 640 of 2020) is amended, in the Sea Area entry entitled South Coast of Ireland, by substituting for the matter in the first column – (a) in the second last entry “Toe Head to Fastnet Rock”, and (b) in the last entry “Fastnet Rock to Streek Head”.

Question: What is the stated purpose of these amendment Rules concerning the Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ships) Rules 2020?

Passages.Passage: These Rules amend Schedule 1, Sea Areas, to the Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ships) Rules 2020 (S.I. No. 640 of 2020) in relation to two Sea Area locations off the South Coast of Ireland.

Question: For what overall financial purpose are the sums in this Order determined to be available?

Passages.Passage: 2. The sums set out in column (5) of the Schedule, amounting in the aggregate to €819,261,000 are determined to be available for making good supply in the year ending 31 December 2022 for the capital supply services and purposes by reference to the Vote Number, Title, Capital Subheads and Descriptions mentioned in columns (1), (2), (3) and (4), respectively, of that Schedule.

Question: What categories of expenditure are covered under the Schedule attached to this Order?

Passages.Passage: SCHEDULE Article 2 Details of sums determined for the purposes of Article 2 ... For the salaries and expenses of the Office of the Revenue Commissioners ... For the salaries and expenses of the Office of Public Works ... For the salaries and expenses of the Office of the Minister for Transport, including certain services administered by that Office, for payment of certain grants and certain other services ...

Question: What actions constitute an offence under Regulation 3 of these Regulations?

Passages.Passage: 3. (1) A person who contravenes a provision of Council Regulation (EU) No. 208/2014 ... Council Regulation (EU) 2022/263 specified in paragraph 5 of Part 1 of Schedule 2, shall be guilty of an offence. (2) A person who contravenes a condition of an authorisation granted under a provision of the same Council Regulations shall be guilty of an offence.

Question: What penalties apply to a person found guilty of an offence under Regulation 3?

Passages.Passage: 4. A person who is guilty of an offence under Regulation 3 shall be liable - (a) on summary conviction, to a class A fine or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 12 months or both, or (b) on conviction on indictment, to a fine not exceeding €500,000 or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 3 years or both.

Question: When do the provisions of the Health Insurance (Amendment) Act 2021 come into operation under this Order?

Passages.Passage: 2. The 1st day of April 2022 is appointed as the day on which the Health Insurance (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 47 of 2021), other than paragraphs (b) and (c) of section 5 and insofar as that Act is not already in operation, shall come into operation.

Question: What key operational changes are introduced by the commencement of the Health Insurance (Amendment) Act 2021?

Passages.Passage: This Order appoints 1 April 2022 as the date on which the provisions of the Health Insurance (Amendment) Act 2021 which concern the operation of the new Risk Equalisation Scheme come into effect. Those provisions concern the introduction of high cost claim credits to the operation of the Scheme, and of a new benchmark for reasonable profit for the purpose of the overcompensation test.

Question: What changes do these Rules introduce to the existing Rules of the Superior Courts?

Passages.Passage: 2. The Rules of the Superior Courts (No. 1)(Powers of Attorney Act 1996) 2000 (S.I. No. 66 of 2000) are amended by the insertion immediately following Regulation 3 thereof of the following Regulation: “4. The forms set out in the Appendix shall be inserted into the Rules of the Superior Courts as Appendix MM, immediately following Appendix LL.”

Question: What is the purpose of inserting Appendix MM into the Rules of the Superior Courts?

Passages.Passage: These Rules amend S.I. No. 66 of 2000 by the insertion of Regulation 4 to provide that the forms set out in the appendix be inserted into the Rules of the Superior Courts as Appendix MM and amend Order 129, rules 3(1) and (6), 4(1) and 5(4) to refer to Appendix MM.

Question: Which institutions are required to pay a levy under these Regulations and what exemption applies?

Passages.Passage: 3. (1) Every person who on 1 January 2022 is an institution within the meaning of Regulation 166 of the Bank Recovery and Resolution Regulations shall pay a levy in respect of the levy period 2022 to the Bank for the account of the Bank and Investment Firm Resolution Fund. (2) Paragraph (1) does not apply to an institution that is an entity referred to in Article 2 of the SRM Regulation.

Question: How does the Bank determine the risk indicators used to calculate levies for Union branches and Limited Activity Investment Firms?

Passages.Passage: SCHEDULE DETERMINATION OF ADDITIONAL RISK INDICATORS ... For the purposes of determining the risk indicator referred to in Article 6(5)(a) of the Commission Delegated Regulation, the following sub-indicators are determined: (a) Trading Ratio (Assets); (b) Trading Ratio (Common Equity Tier 1 Capital); ... (i) Off Balance Sheet Exposure Ratio (Total Risk Exposure). Each sub-indicator has an equal weight.

Question: Who commits an offence under these Regulations and what penalties may be imposed upon conviction?

Passages.Passage: 3. (1) A person who contravenes a provision of the Council Regulation specified in Part 1 of the Schedule 2 shall be guilty of an offence. (2) A person who contravenes a condition of an authorisation granted under a provision of the Council Regulation specified in Part 2 of the Schedule 2 shall be guilty of an offence.

4. A person who is guilty of an offence under Regulation 3 shall be liable - (a) on summary conviction, to a class A fine or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 12 months or both, or (b) on conviction on indictment, to a fine not exceeding €500,000 or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 3 years or both.

Question: What powers are granted to competent authorities under these Regulations to ensure compliance with the EU sanctions on Myanmar/Burma?

Passages.Passage: 5. A competent authority in the State, following such consultation as it considers necessary with other competent authorities, for the purposes of the administration and enforcement of the Council Regulation or these Regulations, may give in writing such directions to a person as it sees fit.

Question: What is the effective commencement date for the remaining provisions of the CervicalCheck Tribunal Act 2019 under this Order?

Passages.Passage: 2. The 23rd day of May 2022 is appointed as the day on which the CervicalCheck Tribunal Act 2019 (No. 31 of 2019) shall, in so far as it is not already in operation, come into operation.

Question: What statutory instrument is brought into operation by this Order, and who signed it into effect?

Passages.Passage: GIVEN under my Official Seal, 18 May, 2022. STEPHEN DONNELLY, Minister for Health.

Question: What specific amendments are made to the sitting schedule for the Letterkenny District Court under this Order?

Passages.Passage: 2. The First Schedule to the District Court (Areas) Order, 1961 (S.I. No. 5 of 1961), is hereby amended by the substitution at reference number 65 for the matter in column (4) of the following: “Letterkenny – First, Second, Third and Fourth Monday in each month. First Tuesday in each month. First and Second Wednesday in each month. First, Third and Fourth Thursday in each month. All sitting at 10.30am.”

Question: How does this Order affect proceedings already initiated before its commencement?

Passages.Passage: 4. Business transacted in the District Court that is initiated and not completed before commencement of this Order shall be continued and completed as if this Order had been in force at the time at which such business had been initiated.

Question: What legal effect does Regulation 2 of this Order have in relation to the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2022?

Passages.Passage: 2. The 26th day of July 2022 is appointed as the day on which Parts 2 and 3 of the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2022 (No. 19 of 2022) shall come into operation.

Question: Which Minister is responsible for bringing Parts 2 and 3 of the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2022 into operation under this Order?

Passages.Passage: GIVEN under my Official Seal, 25 July, 2022. RODERIC O'GORMAN, Minister for Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and Youth.

Question: How does Regulation 2 define the scope of undertakings to which the Business Expenditure on Research and Development Survey Order 2022 applies?

Passages.Passage: 3. This Order applies to an undertaking that is classified for statistical purposes under any section of NACE Rev. 2 set out in Annex I to Regulation (EC) No. 1893/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 20 December 2006, as amended by subsequent Regulations.

Question: What specific categories of information must undertakings provide under the Schedule to this Order for the purpose of the Business Expenditure on R&D Survey?

Passages.Passage: SCHEDULE Article 4 Information regarding the following, as it relates to the undertaking: the nature of its business activity, expenditure on in-house R&D, sources of funds, categories of R&D activity, number and qualifications of persons involved, and engagement in joint R&D projects.

Question: What entitlement does Regulation 2 confer regarding the provision of medical lenses under the Treatment Benefit scheme?

Passages.Passage: 110B. A person shall be entitled to medical appliance benefit in relation to the provision of medical lenses once in every two years, or such other frequency as may, from time to time, be fixed by the Minister.

Question: What is the stated purpose of these Regulations as outlined in the explanatory note?

Passages.Passage: These Regulations provide for the frequency of the payment of the grant for contact lenses supplied for medical reasons under the Treatment Benefit scheme to once every two years.

Question: Which parts of the Circular Economy and Miscellaneous Provisions Act 2022 are commenced by this Order, and on what date?

Passages.Passage: 2. The 23rd day of August 2022 is appointed as the day on which the following provisions of the Circular Economy and Miscellaneous Provisions Act 2022 (No. 26 of 2022) shall come into operation: (a) Part 1, other than section 5; (b) Part 6.

Question: Which Minister signed this Order bringing parts of the Circular Economy and Miscellaneous Provisions Act 2022 into effect?

Passages.Passage: GIVEN under my Official Seal, 22 August 2022. EAMON RYAN Minister for the Environment, Climate and Communications.

Question: What are the prescribed payment and operational periods for the Electricity Costs Emergency Benefit Scheme II as established under Regulations 4, 5, and 6?

Passages.Passage: 4. The following dates are prescribed for the purposes of section 4(1)(e) of the Act of 2022: (a) in respect of the first payment period, 27 October 2022; (b) in respect of the second payment period, 20 December 2022; (c) in respect of the third payment period, 27 February 2023.

6. The following periods are prescribed for the purposes of section 5(2) of the Act of 2022: (a) 1 November 2022 to 31 December 2022; (b) 1 January 2023 to 28 February 2023; (c) 1 March 2023 to 30 April 2023.

Question: What ministerial consents are recorded for the making of these Regulations?

Passages.Passage: The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the foregoing Regulations. GIVEN under my Official Seal, 19 October, 2022. MICHAEL MCGRATH, Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. GIVEN under my Official Seal, 19 October, 2022. EAMON RYAN, Minister for the Environment, Climate and Communications.

Question: What prohibitions are imposed under Regulation 5 regarding activities within the designated Special Area of Conservation?

Passages.Passage: 5. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), a person shall not carry out, cause or permit to be carried out or continue to carry out, or assist in carrying out, any activity specified in Schedule 4 within the Special Area of Conservation except with, and in accordance with, consent given by the Minister under Regulation 30 of the Regulations of 2011.

Question: What penalties and enforcement powers are established under Regulations 6 and 9 for offences related to the Special Area of Conservation?

Passages.Passage: 6. (1) A person who carries out, causes or permits to be carried out, or assists in the carrying out of an activity referred to in Regulation 5(1), without a consent or otherwise than in accordance with a consent given by the Minister under Regulation 30 of the Regulations of 2011, commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a class A fine or imprisonment for a term not exceeding 6 months, or both.

9. A person appointed as an authorised officer under Regulation 4 of the Regulations of 2011 for the purposes of ensuring compliance with these Regulations may exercise the powers of an authorised officer under Part 2 of the Regulations of 2011.

Question: When does the Development (Emergency Electricity Generation) Act 2022 come into operation under this Commencement Order?

Passages.Passage: 2. The 11th day of November 2022 is appointed as the day on which the Development (Emergency Electricity Generation) Act 2022 (No. 35 of 2022) shall come into operation. GIVEN under my Official Seal, 10 November, 2022. EAMON RYAN, Minister for the Environment, Climate and Communications.

Question: Which Minister is responsible for enacting this Order and under what authority is it issued?

Passages.Passage: GIVEN under my Official Seal, 10 November, 2022. EAMON RYAN, Minister for the Environment, Climate and Communications.

Question: What identification requirements must a person meet before possessing or supplying a bovine under Regulation 4 of the Bovine Identification Regulations 2022?

Passages.Passage: 4. (1) A person shall not have a bovine to which these Regulations apply in his or her possession or under his or her control, move, transport, sell or supply the bovine unless the bovine is identified with – (a) a conventional ear-tag ... attached to one ear, and (b) an electronic identification device ... attached to the ear to which subparagraph (a) does not refer.

Question: What powers does the Minister have under Regulation 9 in relation to the approval of persons manufacturing or supplying bovine identification devices?

Passages.Passage: 9. (1) The persons approved for the purposes of these Regulations to manufacture, sell and supply conventional ear-tags and electronic identification devices are mentioned in the Schedule. (3) The Minister may attach conditions to an approval under this Regulation, vary or revoke a condition or attach a new condition. (7) Without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (3), the Minister may refuse an application or suspend or revoke an approval under this Regulation...

Question: Which provision of the Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 is brought into operation by this Order, and from what date?

Passages.Passage: 2. The 1st day of December 2022 is appointed as the day on which section 56 of the Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 (No. 50 of 2021) shall come into operation.

Question: Who signed the Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 (Commencement of Certain Provisions) (No. 4) Order 2022, and what is the statutory publication notice associated with it?

Passages.Passage: GIVEN under my Official Seal, 23 November, 2022. DARRAGH O’BRIEN, Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in “Iris Oifigiúil” of 2nd December, 2022.

Question: What financial contribution is specified under this Order and for which statutory provision does it apply?

Passages.Passage: 3. The amount of €800 is specified for the purposes of section 9(1)(b) of the Act of 2022.

Question: Which Ministers jointly issued the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2022 (Section 9(2)) (Amount of Financial Contribution) Order 2022?

Passages.Passage: GIVEN under my Official Seal, 13 December, 2022. HEATHER HUMPHREYS, Minister for Social Protection. MICHAEL MCGRATH, Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. RODERIC O'GORMAN, Minister for Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and Youth.

Question: What amendment does Regulation 2 introduce regarding the attribution of self-employment contributions for the 2021 contribution year?

Passages.Passage: 2. Article 27 (inserted by article 2 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Contributions and Insurability) (Amendment) (No. 2) (Attribution of self-employment contributions) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 730 of 2021)), is amended, by the substitution of “in each of the 2020 and 2021 contribution years.” for “the 2020 contribution year.”.

Question: According to the explanatory note, what is the legislative purpose behind attributing self-employment contributions for Covid-19 pandemic payment recipients?

Passages.Passage: Section 38E(4) (inserted by section 8 of the Social Welfare (Covid-19) (Amendment) Act 2020 (No. 12 of 2020)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 allows the Minister for Social Protection, with the consent of the Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform, to make regulations prescribing the number of self-employment contributions to be attributed to a self-employed contributor who was entitled to and in receipt of the Covid-19 pandemic unemployment payment, or a jobseeker’s payment (who would otherwise be entitled to the Covid-19 pandemic unemployment payment).
